newsitem.title: USA: Niagara Mohawk settles with IPPs.
newsitem.headline: Niagara Mohawk settles with IPPs.

text.p: Niagara Mohawk Power Corp said it has tentatively agreed in principle to restructure or terminate 44 contracts to purchase power from 19 independent power producers.

That is 44 out of over 150 power purchase contracts the utility has with non-regulated generators, spokesman Nicholas J. Ashooh said, pointing out the 44 represent more than 90 percent of its above-market power costs.
Niagara Mohawk said the agreement contemplates it will pay the 19 about $3.6 million in cash and/or debt securities, and 46 million common shares.
